node.title: 'What a long time you have waited for this': Massive tract of Cape York land handed back to traditional owners
node.alt: A young girl swings her hair, while others in matching T-shirts dance in the courtyard
node.description: The first claims in one of Australia's largest native title applications has been granted on Cape York, the culmination of the "hard work and determinationÂ of a lot of people".
node.content: ["In a landmark case, 2,188 square kilometres of land have been handed back to\u00a0Kuuku Ya'u and Uutaanlanu people.\u00a0", "The determination was announced in the Supreme Court in Cairns, seven years after the claim was registered.\u00a0", "The land covers an area on the eastern side of Cape York, in the Lockhart River coastal region and will be\u00a0managed by the Kaapay Kuuyun Aboriginal Corporation and the Uutaalnganu Aboriginal Corporation.", "It is\u00a0the\u00a0first two successful determinations in the\u00a0Cape York United #1 claim, which has been filed\u00a0on behalf of Cape York traditional owners and is\u00a0one of the largest areas registered for a claim in Australia.\u00a0", "The full claim covers more than half of Cape York with a total of more than 79,000 square kilometres.", "In the determination, Justice Debra Mortimer said \"today can only happen because of the hard work and determination of a lot of people\".", "\"What a long time you have waited for this \u2026 I am sorry it has taken so long,\" she said.", "More to come."]
